problem.description: According to the Uganda National Planning Authority (NPA), 41% of the Ugandan population faces unemployment and limited educational opportunities. Among them, young girls and women constitute 60%. This significant unemployment rate, coupled with limited access to quality education, leaves many adolescents and youth, especially in marginalized communities, without the skills and opportunities needed to secure decent work and improve their livelihoods.

solution.description: Level Up focuses on helping out-of-school adolescents and youth transition to decent work. This program is designed to address the critical gap in education and employment opportunities by providing targeted support through structured bootcamps and mentorship.

description.name: Incubation Phase
description.description: Participants receive hands-on support to bring their ideas to life, ensuring they achieve product-market fit and are ready for the market.

problem.description: Uganda has the second youngest population in the world, with more than 78% of the population below the age of 30. Despite this youthfulness, a significant portion of the young labor force is neither in education nor any form of employment. The employment landscape in Uganda is shifting, with a growing emphasis on soft skills. According to a 2022 report by the Federation of Uganda Employers and the International Labour Organization, 80% of employers now prioritize skills such as innovation, problem-solving, and teamwork. Annually, over 400,000 individuals graduate from higher education institutions in Uganda, yet an estimated 280,000 find themselves unemployed or underemployed. This highlights a critical mismatch between the skills taught in educational institutions and those required by employers. The demand for 21st-century skills is rapidly increasing as the job market evolves. According to UNICEF, young people in Uganda must navigate a transforming world where technology, migration, climate change, and rapidly changing job markets are reshaping society. Despite this, many adolescents and youth lack essential skills such as innovation, critical thinking, communication, creativity, teamwork, and collaboration.

solution.description: Thrive at Work focuses on helping adolescents and youth acquire essential 21st-century skills that are highly demanded in the workplace. Our program uses real-world applications and projects to allow participants to practice these skills. When they are ready, we match them with employment opportunities in their chosen fields and continue to offer career guidance to maximize their productivity and value in the workplace.

description.description: The core of the Thrive at Work program is its focus on developing essential 21st-century skills through practical, hands-on learning experiences. Participants engage in projects that simulate real-world challenges, allowing them to apply and hone their skills in a supportive environment.

stories_of_impact.name: Liberty Yumaru
stories_of_impact.story: Liberty Yumaru’s journey with Amariatek began with curiosity and hope. Eager to unlock her potential, she joined the program, finding the sessions both educational and deeply inspiring. Through various activities, Liberty discovered her strengths and cultivated a strong sense of self-love, empowerment, and confidence. The learning process enhanced her communication and leadership skills, instilling a deep sense of purpose. Reflecting on her experience, Liberty urges others to embark on this life-changing journey. “Trust me; your future self will thank you for it,” she says. Today, Liberty is excelling in her role at a bank, applying the skills and confidence gained from the program daily. Her career growth and personal development are testaments to the profound impact of the Amariatek program.

stories_of_impact.name: IMANI BARHAME GEDEON
stories_of_impact.story: As the founder and CEO of Lamuka Innovation Center in the Nakivale Refugee Settlement, IMANI BARHAME GEDEON always believed in the potential of every individual. However, the path to success was filled with challenges and uncertainties. Everything changed when IMANI participated in a program organized by the Amariatek Foundation. Through this training, IMANI gained valuable insights, practical knowledge, and essential tools to navigate the complexities of entrepreneurship. The program provided the skills needed to thrive in the world of work. Reflecting on this transformative journey, IMANI says, “The support from Amariatek was instrumental in turning my vision into reality. It gave me the confidence to overcome obstacles and make a meaningful impact.” Today, Lamuka Innovation Center stands as a beacon of hope, empowering refugees and fostering innovation. IMANI’s journey with Amariatek not only transformed personal and professional life but also created lasting change within the refugee community.

problem.description: Uganda has the second youngest population in the world, with more than 78% of its population below the age of 30. Despite this youthfulness, many adolescents and youth face significant challenges as they transition into adulthood. These challenges include mental health breakdowns, alcohol and substance abuse, and teenage pregnancies. Mental Health: Approximately 22.9% of children and 24.2% of adults in Uganda suffer from mental disorders. Depression and anxiety are prevalent, with 4.6% of the population experiencing depression and 2.9% dealing with anxiety. Substance Abuse: Substance abuse is a significant issue, with 60-71% of school-going children (ages 12 to 24) using addictive substances. Alcohol is the most commonly abused substance, with 23.3% of adolescents having used it. Teenage Pregnancies: According to the Uganda Bureau of Statistics, 25% of Ugandan girls become pregnant by age 19. This high rate of teenage pregnancies is a major concern, leading to school dropouts and limiting future opportunities for young girls.

solution.description: The 'I Thrive' program focuses on equipping adolescents and youth with essential life skills to help them transition into adulthood and navigate the challenges of adolescence. We support both in-school and out-of-school adolescents and youth, providing them with the skills and guidance they need to tackle day-to-day challenges.

description.description: The core of the I Thrive program is its focus on developing essential life skills through practical, hands-on learning experiences. Participants engage in activities that build self-esteem, teach them about their rights, and help them develop skills in personal finance, creativity, innovation, problem-solving, and emotional intelligence. These activities are designed to be interactive and engaging, ensuring that participants can apply what they learn in real-world situations.

We deliver the program through a series of workshops and mentoring sessions, following standards set by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) and other best practices for life skills education. Our workshops are held weekly and cover a range of topics.

problem.description: According to the Uganda Registration Services Bureau, over 75% of new businesses fail within the first two years of operation in Uganda. A survey by the Federation of Small and Medium Enterprises found that 36% of small businesses are at risk of closing due to cash flow and operational challenges. The high failure rate is often attributed to a lack of proper business management skills, limited access to financial resources, and inadequate support systems.

solution.description: Elevate is designed to help and support small businesses through targeted training, mentorship, and professional support, ensuring they become more sustainable and profitable. Under the theme 'Small Businesses Must Make Money,' Elevate focuses on equipping participants with essential business skills and knowledge in marketing, financial management, leadership development, and operational efficiency.

description.description: Comprehensive workshops and training sessions covering essential business skills and knowledge. These sessions are designed to be interactive and practical, providing participants with the tools they need to succeed.
One-on-one and group mentorship from experienced business professionals to guide participants through challenges and opportunities, providing personalized advice and support.
Access to a network of professionals offering advice and support in marketing, finance, and operations, helping participants build connections and gain insights from industry experts.
